body:
# kubectl version

```
Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"3", GitVersion:"v1.3.0", GitCommit:"283137936a498aed572ee22af6774b6fb6e9fd94", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2016-07-01T19:26:38Z", GoVersion:"go1.6.2", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"3", GitVersion:"v1.3.0", GitCommit:"283137936a498aed572ee22af6774b6fb6e9fd94", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2016-07-01T19:19:19Z", GoVersion:"go1.6.2", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
```
# OS

local machine

```
Linux 3.19.0-25-generic #26~14.04.1-Ubuntu SMP Fri Jul 24 21:16:20 UTC 2015 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
```
# problem

https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/test/images/pets/redis/on-start.sh#L32

The Line 32 `sed -i -e "s|^.*slaveof.*$|slaveof ${LINE} ${PORT}|" ${CFG}` replaced 2 lines which include word 'slaveof' in the templatefile

```
# Master-Slave replication. Use slaveof to make a Redis instance a copy of
#    network partition slaves automatically try to reconnect to masters
#    and resynchronize with them.
#
# slaveof <masterip> <masterport>
```
## The results I received

```
slaveof rd-0.redis 6379
#    network partition slaves automatically try to reconnect to masters
#    and resynchronize with them.
#
slaveof rd-0.redis 6379
```
## The results I expected

```
# Master-Slave replication. Use slaveof to make a Redis instance a copy of
#    network partition slaves automatically try to reconnect to masters
#    and resynchronize with them.
#
slaveof rd-0.redis 6379
```
title: wrong regex in test/images/pets/redis/on-start.sh L32
